answers.answer: For many women their monthly cycle lasts 28 days.  It starts on the first day of your period and ends the day before your period starts the next month.  This length of time varies greatly from woman to woman though.  Some women have longer or shorter cycles and others have irregular ones, meaning they may have a 27 days cycle one month and 35 the next, etc.Typically a woman ovulates 10-14 days BEFORE her period starts.  Again, this is just an estimate and can vary from woman to woman.

Frequent peeing is not a symptom of early pregnancy, but it might be a good idea to take a pregnancy test just so you won't worry about it.
yea I took one and it was negative so I'm not worried about being pregnant I jus find it very werid that its so frequent
Have you been checked for a UTI, Bladder or kidney infection?  These can present without typical symptoms as well.

You got great information! Typical cycle is 28 days. Mine is 32 days. If I were to mark on the calendar that my period started March 13 that would be the first day of my cycle. So after 28 days pass I would expect to get my next period and the cycle would start over.Day One - Period startsDay 14 or so - OvulationDay 28 - Day before next period should beginWomen do ovulate about 14 days BEFORE their period and with a typical 28-day cycle that would be roughly day 14 of the cycle.
